current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of State to offer rewards totaling up to $10,000,000
for information on the kidnapping and murder of James Foley and Steven Sotloff.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall offer a reward to any individual who furnishes
			 information leading to the arrest or conviction in any country of any
			 individual for committing, conspiring or attempting to commit, or aiding
			 or abetting in the commission of the kidnapping and murder of James Foley
			 or Steven Sotloff.

text.#text: In accordance with the Rewards for Justice program authorized under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 36(b) of the State
			 Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956/s:36/ss:b

text.#text:
The total amount of rewards offered under subsection (a) may not exceed $10,000,000, and the total
			 amount of rewards offered in connection with the kidnapping and murder of
			 either one of the individuals named in such subsection may not exceed
			 $5,000,000.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2778 IS: To require the Secretary of State to offer rewards totaling up to $10,000,000 for information on the kidnapping and murder of James Foley and Steven Sotloff.
